title: Bug 21706 - BidiUtil in win32 has Class.forName() usage
OB:
The BidiUtil class in win32 uses Class.forName() method which leads to a NoClassDefFoundError in the CLDC version of SWT. The following line in the org.eclipse.swt.internal.BidiUtil class causes this issue: 

static Callback callback = new Callback (BidiUtil.class, "windowProc", 4);
EB:
To resolve this problem, the line should be modified as follows:

static Callback callback = new Callback (new BidiUtil().getClass(), "windowProc", 4);
SR: The proposed solution has not been tested yet, but it is expected to work correctly.
